greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations of [n] with exactly k (possibly overlapping) occurrences of the generalized pattern 12-3; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=(n-1)*(n-2)/2-[n=0], read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..50, flattened
A. Claesson and T. Mansour, Counting occurrences of a pattern of type (1,2) or (2,1) in permutations, arXiv:math/0110036 [math.CO], 2001
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0)):
mathematica: b[u_, o_] := b[u, o] = If[u + o == 0, 1, Sum[b[u - j, o + j - 1], {j, 1, u}] + Sum[Expand[b[u + j - 1, o - j]*x^(o - j)], {j, 1, o}]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 0] ]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 10 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 14 2015
